intro: Eupatorium esperanzae, commonly known as Esperanza Bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. It produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is often bluish-green, contributing to its common name and adding visual interest to the landscape.
